meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring the salinity of water.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a salinometer to check how salty the ocean water was.
meanings.sent2: The crew on the ship relied on the salinometer to ensure the safety of their desalination process.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous dolphin stole the salinometer, chaos ensued in the marine lab.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a salinometer, always able to detect the slightest hint of salt in the air.
meanings.sent5: The shiny salinometer gleamed in the sunlight, a vital tool for the marine researchers.

meanings.definition: A device used to determine the concentration of salt in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The chef used a salinometer to make sure the soup had just the right amount of salt.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician carefully calibrated the salinometer before testing the salt levels in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the salinometer, causing a salty mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a salinometer, always able to detect the saltiness in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The old salinometer hummed softly as it analyzed the salt concentration in the seawater sample.
